block.p: For more than 2,000 adoptees in Oregon who have applied to see their original birth certificates, the long wait is about to end. United States Supreme Court Justice Sandra Day O'Connor refused a request by a group of birth mothers to block a law passed by the state's voters in 1998 granting any adopted adult access to the birth records. The birth mothers had argued that the nation's first such voter-approved law was an unconscionable privacy violation, but adoptees said they have an even more basic right to try to discover where they came from -- and what their biological parents' medical histories might be.
